title: Yasuo - Small tweak that makes a difference
body:
There is a lot of threads asking for some nerfs of the Yasuo's Kit. But none with this simple idea : Just let the opponents to see the marks applied by **Sweeping Blade (E)**.

This tiny adjustment can make the difference when you are vs a Yasuo and when you try to predict where he will be in the next few milliseconds to land a skillshot.

Clarity is a goal for Riot anyway. I think it's a step in the good direction.

replies.body: I don't see why enemies shouldn't see that, ok for me too.
I think it's because it would create a lot of visual clutter, not because Riot wants to actively keep that information away from players.

That is indeed why the CD timer's only visible to Yasuo. It's information that's of interest to other players, but anything visually communicated comes at the expense of every other visual element on display (more stuff on screen doesn't necessarily mean more clarity). In this case we felt the value of showing the timers was lower than the cost, particularly given that's a style of visual effect used by other champions as well (Nautilus for example) and stacking multiple of those effects together leads to a really messy effect. 

A similar example is which effects show up on the buff bar. For an ability or effect in isolation more information will pretty much always be clearer. When there are already half a dozen buffs on a character already however we feel clarity's overall improved by trimming out any that are overall of low importance (e.g. minor effects from masteries) to make it easier to follow the really significant stuff (e.g. Annie passive stacks or Baron buff duration).
I dunno, I'd prefer to be able to see which of my minions Yasuo could use to dodge my abilities rather then the ground.

I understand that and figure that will be the case for a number of people. Main thing I wanted to offer here was some context on how this is something we've looked at, thought about and decided not to do, rather than something we haven't considered or having made time for.

Would it be possible to put this change on pbe nonetheless, to see how much of a difference it makes to players? I personally would rank this as just as useful as knowing when Annie's stun is up - knowing in which directions Yasuo is able to dodge your abilities is just as important as knowing when Annie is able to stun you. Putting it on pbe sounds like a good way to evaluate whether or not the benefit is worth the cost, which it is in my opinion at least.

I could even see it be implemented as an option that acts as the opposite of the Noise Removal option. This would give people the option to enable it in game's where there's someone like a Yasuo to turn it on if they feel it would help, or keep it off (default) to keep the clutter at it's current levels.

One of the bigger things I see possibly arising from this is something akin to information overlap. Nautlius and Yasuo have the same indicator for their passive and E respectively, so if you were able to see both how long Yasuo has until he can dash to a target again _and_ how long until Nautilus can root a target again, there would need to be additional precautions to make sure that the indicators don't look identical and thustly lose meaning when both are present.

Could you let players toggle this?

I'd prefer to see it, even if my other teammates wouldn't want to.

60 seconds is an ultimate's cooldown. The only basic abilities with cooldowns above 30 seconds tend to be strong vision control abilities, and there is not one defensive non-ultimate with a cooldown that high.

And before you say anything about ultimates being negated by Wind Wall, **there are several abilities that can already negate ultimates.** Yes, Yasuo can block for his team. Other champions can protect their whole team as well.
